task_summary: Detect the T-block and goal outline, approach and align, then push the block in two stages toward the goal before retreating.

task_long_description.overview: A fixed-base manipulator with a circular end-effector must push a T-shaped block across a tabletop into a drawn goal outline. The sequence uses perception to localize both the block and the goal, approaches from above to establish contact, aligns its yaw to set a pushing direction, and executes a set of straight pushes to seat the block inside the outline. The process assumes 10 Hz observation/control, modest timeouts, and no grasping. The robot finally retreats, leaving the block placed.
preconditions: Tabletop is clear except for one T-shaped block and the goal outline
Camera/pose estimation available for block and goal
End-effector calibration complete; safe workspace limits set
Friction sufficient for planar pushing without sliding out of control
stepwise_plan: Move above and approach the block to make gentle contact
Execute staged pushes to translate and orient the block into the outline
success_criteria: Final T-block pose overlaps the goal outline within tolerance
No object leaves the workspace; no collisions with fixtures
Robot retreats to a safe standoff
failure_and_recovery: If contact is lost or misalignment occurs: re-approach and re-push
If motion insufficient: additional short push
If timeout occurs: abort and notify
task_long_description.termination: Terminate after final push, successful retreat, or any unrecoverable timeout.

frame_3.now_evidence: First clear contact with the T-block aligned to the outline.
frame_3.predicts_next: Suggests push actuation will follow along the outline direction.

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Move above the block to a safe pre-contact height.
Close in and align before pushing.
Orient the end-effector for a diagonal push.
First diagonal push toward the goal.
Short corrective push for final fit.

failure_modes: Yaw misalignment yields rotation instead of translation
recovery_strategy: Re-approach and re-align then push again
assumptions: Frames show a red T-block and blue goal outline; instruction mentions gray block and green target—logged as dataset color mismatch.
Push directions 225° then 180° inferred from observed motion; exact angles approximate.
No grasping; pure planar pushing with constant contact.

expected_success_criteria: Block centroid and orientation match the outline within tolerance 0.005–0.02
Robot ends in a safe standoff
